key_title: Key to the genera of Haloragaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Haloragaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Haloragaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plants usually aquatic or semi-aquatic; leaves often whorled; petals on female flowers vestigial or lacking; fruit splitting at maturity into 1-seeded mericarps
Plants terrestrial (except Meionectes brownii); leaves never whorled; all flowers with prominent petals; fruit an indehiscent nut
Terrestrial herbs, not rooting from lower nodes; leaves entire to trifid; sepals and petals 4; stamens 8; ovary 4-locular
Aquatic or semi-aquatic herbs, usually rooting from lower nodes; leaves pinnatifid to pinnatissect; sepals and petals 2; stamens 4; ovary 2-locular
Fruit less than 2 mm long, inconspicuous, often ribbed but never winged
Fruit more than 3 mm long, showy, usually prominently winged
Perennial herb to 50 cm tall; flowers in flat-topped cymes, fruit yellow or bright reddish; inland parts of western Victoria only
Shrubs 1–2 m tall, flowers in spike-like inflorescences, fruit green or dark reddish; mountainous regions of East Gippsland only
